oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A view of the water fountain at the Davidson County Courthouse, Nashville, Tennessee, 1968 November
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A view of the water fountain at the Davidson County Courthouse, located in downtown Nashville, Tennessee, circa November 1968. The Davidson County Courthouse, also known as Metropolitan Courthouse, is an Art Deco building built in 1936. It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1987. It was designed by Nashville architect Emmons H. Woolwine and the firm of Dennison and Hirons of New York. Forms part of the Alfred Lane Futrell Collection. 1 photograph.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Davidson County Court House (Nashville, Tenn.)--History--Sources
